intro: Pelecyphora chihuahuensis subsp. chihuahuensis, commonly known as the Chihuahua pelecyphora, is a rare plant species native to the Chihuahua region of Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in arid to semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is of particular interest to botanists and conservationists.
